11-year-old male.context: The patient is an 11-year-old male who was admitted from the ER after a CT scan suggested that the child had mastoiditis.

mastoiditis.context: The patient is an 11-year-old male who was admitted from the ER after a CT scan suggested that the child had mastoiditis.

severe ear pain.context: The child has had very severe ear pain and blood draining from the right ear.

blood draining.context: The child has had very severe ear pain and blood draining from the right ear.

temperature of 101.4.context: The child had a temperature maximum of 101.4 in the ER.

IV Unasyn.context: The patient was admitted and started on IV Unasyn, which he tolerated well and required Morphine and Vicodin for pain control.

Morphine.context: The patient was admitted and started on IV Unasyn, which he tolerated well and required Morphine and Vicodin for pain control.

Vicodin.context: The patient was admitted and started on IV Unasyn, which he tolerated well and required Morphine and Vicodin for pain control.

swelling of cervical area.context: In the first 12 hours after admission, the patient's pain decreased and also swelling of his cervical area decreased.

right acute otitis media.context: Discharge Diagnoses: 1. Suspected mastoiditis ruled out. 2. Right acute otitis media.

no redness.context: HEENT: Right ear shows no redness.

nontender.context: The area behind his ear is nontender.

large posterior chains node.context: There is a large posterior chains node that is nontender and the swelling in this area has decreased markedly.

Ciprodex Otic Solution.context: Discharge Medications: 1. Ciprodex Otic Solution in the right ear twice daily.

Augmentin.context: Discharge Medications: 2. Augmentin 500 mg three times daily x10 days.
